title: Visual Studio Team Services Deployments
name: auth0-visualstudio-deploy
author: auth0
description: This extension gives Auth0 customers the possibility to deploy Hosted Pages, Rules and Custom Database Connections from Visual Studio Team Services.
uninstallConfirmMessage: Do you really want to uninstall this extension? Doing so will stop any Hosted Pages, Rules and Database Connection scripts from being deployed from Visual Studio Team Services to Auth0

auth0.scopes: read:client_grants create:client_grants delete:client_grants update:client_grants read:clients update:clients delete:clients create:clients read:client_keys update:client_keys delete:client_keys create:client_keys read:connections update:connections delete:connections create:connections read:resource_servers update:resource_servers delete:resource_servers create:resource_servers read:rules update:rules delete:rules create:rules read:rules_configs update:rules_configs delete:rules_configs read:email_provider update:email_provider delete:email_provider create:email_provider read:tenant_settings update:tenant_settings read:grants delete:grants read:guardian_factors update:guardian_factors read:email_templates create:email_templates update:email_templates

REPOSITORY.description: The project from which you want to deploy rules and database scripts

BRANCH.description: The branch we should monitor for commits

PATH.description: The path we should monitor for commits

INSTANCE.description: Your Visual Studio Team Services instance name (without .visualstudio.com)

USERNAME.description: Your Visual Studio Team Services username

AUTH_METHOD.description: You can choose between PAT and Basic (Alternate authentication credentials)

PASSWORD.description: Your Visual Studio password (Alternate authentication credentials)

TOKEN.description: Your personal access token for Visual Studio Team Services

BASE_DIR.description: Path to your tenant settings directories

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Webhook URL for Slack used to notify you of successful and failed deployments
